text: This rivalry is between Recto's San Sebastian and Mendiola's San Beda. ==Head- to-head record by sport== ===Seniors' Division=== ====General Championship==== San Beda has 6 General Championships while San Sebastian has 4 in the General Championship record. *San Beda (6) - 2010-11, 2011-2012, 2012-2013, 2014-2015, 2015-2016, 2016-2017 *San Sebastian (4) - 1984-1985, 1988-1989, 1989-1990, 1994-1995 ===Juniors' Division=== ====General Championship==== San Beda leads the general championship race with 11-0.NCAA Philippines - Championships *San Beda (11) - 1982, 1988, 1989, 1990, 1991, 1993, 1995, 1996, 1997, 2015 *San Sebastian (6) - 2005, 2006, 2009, 2010, 2011, 2012 ==Basketball Statistics== ===Men's basketball results=== Both teams are expected to meet at least 2 times per year. Since 2008, San Beda leads the rivalry 20-8 {|class=wikitable style="font-size:85%;" |- !width=100px|Date !!width=100px| San Beda !!width=100px| San Sebastian !!width=190px|Venue !!width=250px|Note/s |- |July 14, 2008|| bgcolor=red| San Beda 84 ||San Sebastian 83 || Cuneta Astrodome, Pasay |||OT. San Beda had a 2-0 record prior to the game. |- |September 3, 2008|| bgcolor=red| San Beda 62 ||San Sebastian 58 || Cuneta Astrodome, Pasay ||| |- |2009|| San Beda 77 ||bgcolor=#FFD700| San Sebastian 83 || The Arena in San Juan, San Juan ||| |- |2009|| bgcolor=red| San Beda 71 ||San Sebastian 67 || The Arena in San Juan, San Juan ||| |- |October 14, 2009|| bgcolor=red| San Beda 71 ||San Sebastian 65 || The Arena in San Juan, San Juan ||| Battle for 1st seed. |- |October 23, 2009|| San Beda 68 ||bgcolor=#FFD700| San Sebastian 72 || Araneta Coliseum, Quezon City ||| Finals Game 1. 2OT. |- |October 26, 2009|| San Beda 61 ||bgcolor=#FFD700| San Sebastian 76 || Araneta Coliseum, Quezon City ||| Finals Game 2. San Sebastian ends season's host, San Beda's 3-peat. |- |2010|| bgcolor=red| San Beda 88 ||San Sebastian 76 || The Arena in San Juan, San Juan ||| Both teams had a 7-0 record prior to the game. |- |2010|| bgcolor=red| San Beda 90 ||San Sebastian 82 || The Arena in San Juan, San Juan ||| San Beda had a 15-0 record prior to the game. San Beda swept the elimination round by beating San Sebastian. |- |October 13, 2010|| bgcolor=red| San Beda 93 ||San Sebastian 73 || Araneta Coliseum, Quezon City ||| Finals Game 1. |- |October 15, 2010|| bgcolor=red| San Beda 85 ||San Sebastian 70 || Araneta Coliseum, Quezon City ||| Finals Game 2. San Beda reclaimed the NCAA crown by beating the season's host, San Sebastian |- |2011|| San Beda 68 ||bgcolor=#FFD700| San Sebastian 70 || The Arena in San Juan, San Juan ||| A repeat of season 85,Both teams had a 8-0 prior to the game San Sebastian gave San Beda its first loss of the season, ending San Beda's 26-game winning streak. |- |2011|| bgcolor=red| San Beda 91 ||San Sebastian 70 || The Arena in San Juan, San Juan ||| |- |October 14, 2011|| bgcolor=red| San Beda 88 ||San Sebastian 85 || The Arena in San Juan, San Juan ||| 1st seed play-off. |- |October 24, 2011|| bgcolor=red| San Beda 75 ||San Sebastian 63 || Smart Araneta Coliseum, Quezon City ||| Finals Game 1. |- |October 26, 2011|| bgcolor=red| San Beda 57 ||San Sebastian 55 || Smart Araneta Coliseum, Quezon City ||| Finals Game 2. San Beda wins its 16th seniors crown. |- |2012|| San Beda 71 ||bgcolor=#FFD700| San Sebastian 80 || The Arena in San Juan, San Juan |||Both teams had a 6-1 record prior to the game. |- |2012|| San Beda 55 ||bgcolor=#FFD700| San Sebastian 69 || The Arena in San Juan, San Juan ||| |- |2013|| bgcolor=red| San Beda 83 ||San Sebastian 64 || The Arena in San Juan, San Juan ||| |- |2013|| bgcolor=red| San Beda 72 ||San Sebastian 68 || The Arena in San Juan, San Juan ||| |- |2014|| bgcolor=red| San Beda 75 ||San Sebastian 56 || The Arena in San Juan, San Juan ||| |- |2014|| bgcolor=red| San Beda 86 ||San Sebastian 79 || The Arena in San Juan, San Juan ||| |- |2015|| bgcolor=red| San Beda 92 ||San Sebastian 81 || The Arena in San Juan, San Juan ||| |- |2015|| San Beda 92 ||bgcolor=#FFD700| San Sebastian 98 || The Arena in San Juan, San Juan ||| |- |August 5, 2016|| bgcolor=red| San Beda 87 ||San Sebastian 77 || The Arena in San Juan, San Juan ||| San Beda had a 7-0 record prior to the game. |- |August 23, 2016|| San Beda 71 ||bgcolor=#FFD700| San Sebastian 72 || The Arena in San Juan, San Juan ||| San Beda had a 10-1 record prior to the game. |- |July 8, 2017|| bgcolor=red| San Beda 76 ||San Sebastian 67 || Mall of Asia Arena, Pasay ||| Opening game. |- |September 15, 2017|| bgcolor=red| San Beda 76 ||San Sebastian 65 || The Arena in San Juan, San Juan ||| |- |November 7, 2017|| bgcolor=red| San Beda 76 ||San Sebastian 71 || Mall of Asia Arena, Pasay ||| Semifinals. San Beda went on to win the championship vs. Lyceum. |- |August 16, 2018 || bgcolor=red| San Beda 65 ||San Sebastian 54 || The Arena in San Juan, San Juan ||| San Beda had a 5-0 record prior to the game.
